snippet: Four members of the six-person jury that acquitted George Zimmerman of second-degree murder said in a statement that the opinions of the anonymous juror who has spoken publicly about the case did not represent their views.
abstract: Four members of the six-person jury that acquitted George Zimmerman of second-degree murder said in a statement that the opinions of the anonymous juror who has spoken publicly about the case did not represent their views.

headline.main: After Zimmerman Verdict, 4 Jurors Distance Themselves From One Who Spoke
